properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 7:18AM EST until January 6 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning has been cancelled for the following river in
Southwest Lower Michigan...

Chippewa River below Mt Pleasant affecting Isabella County

...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County
Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County
Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County

.Rivers in West Michigan continue to respond to recent heavy
rains. Most of the smaller and medium-sized rivers are near their
crest, but the larger rivers will continue to rise for another few
days. The next threat of melting snow and additional rain moves
into the area on Friday and Saturday. Rain and melting snow may be
enough to prolong crests on some of the rivers. The following
forecast is based on observed and forecast 48 hour precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Grand River at Robinson Township.
* until Monday morning.
* at  3:20 PM Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.3 feet.
* Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, the river will continue rising to near 13.4 feet by
Wednesday night. The river will fall below flood stage late this
week or early this weekend.
* Impact, at 13.3 feet...Minor flooding begins in low areas.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 13.4 feet
on Oct 6 2019.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
